q1 module¶

q1.alohomora(n, m)¶

Constructing a checkerboard pattern matrix of dimension NxN which considers each block of dimension MxM as a cell for the pattern.

Parameters

  • n – integers

  • m – integer that divides n

Returns

int numpy Ndarray

Dim

n X n

q1.avada_kedavara(my_list)¶

Doing as directed in the question. Removing comments for because of indemtation errors encountered while executing the code

Parameters

  • my_list – a list of 25 integers

  • a0 – 1D numpy array of 25 elements

  • a1 – 5 X 5 numpy matrix

  • a1cpy – copy of a1 matrix

q1.expelliarmus(arr, theta, axis)¶

:param arr : float Ndarray :dim: Nx3 :param theta: float; 0≤theta<360 (in degrees) :param axis: str; axis ∈ {‘X’,’Y’,’Z’}

Return type

float Ndarray

Dim

N X 3

q1.glisseo(P, Q, R, S)¶
Parameters

  • p – string

  • q – string

  • r – string

  • s – string

  • P – string

  • Q – string

  • R – string

  • S – string

Returns

numpy matrix in the form [[P`,Q`],[R`,S`]]

q1.incendio(my_integer)¶

Doing as directed in the question. Removing comments for because of indemtation errors encountered while executing the code

Parameters

  • my_integer – an even integers

  • arng0 – numpy array

  • arng1 – numpy array

  • mult0 – numpy array

q1.reducio(X, W)¶

Performing Batch Matrix Multiplication

Parameters

  • X – Three dimensional matrix with shape => {B,S,F}

  • W – Two dimensional matrix with shape => {N,F}

Returns

numpy matrix after performing batch matrix multiplication and transforming to shape {B,N,S}
